sentences.en: A third option is that bond investors think today's inflation rates are a blip.
sentences.cn: 第三种解释是债券投资者认为眼下的通胀率已达顶峰.

sentences.en: For most of them even that currency crisis was just a blip.
sentences.cn: 对多数人来说,那场危机不过是暂停了一阵罢了.

sentences.en: The aircraft was then brought into a position where the blip was central.
sentences.cn: 随后,飞机被领航到目标标志点显示在屏幕中心的那个位置.

sentences.en: The Blip is out of focus.
The market had one bad blip today.
sentences.cn: 今天行情出现了短暂的低迷.

sentences.en: This financial crisis was no minor blip, to be forgotten as quickly as possible.
sentences.cn: 此次金融危机决非一段微不足道 、 乃至可以很快忘掉的小插曲.

sentences.en: This year aboard is going to be just a blip in the grand scheme of things!
sentences.cn: 今年的出国对我将来的发展方向很重要.

sentences.en: Was it just a temporary blip on an otherwise healthy growth curve?
sentences.cn: 这是否是原本良好的增长曲线中暂时的偏离？

sentences.en: What interests me is what occurs during the blip and shudder.
sentences.cn: 我所感兴趣的是这波动、颤栗的过程中都发生了什么.

trans.tran_cn: [电子学]尖峰信号，尖头信号，短促而尖锐的声音，（统计数字的）上下浮动，雷达的可视信号
trans.tran_en: A blip is a small spot of light, sometimes occurring with a short, high-pitched sound, which flashes on and off regularly on a piece of equipment such as a radar screen
